meanings.definition: To cause to lose physical fitness or strength.
meanings.sent1: Too much sitting can decondition your muscles over time.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise helps prevent deconditioning of the body.
meanings.sent3: After a week of binge-watching TV shows, I felt completely deconditioned!
meanings.sent4: The lack of sunlight during winter can decondition your mood.
meanings.sent5: Neglecting to use your muscles can lead to deconditioning and weakness.

meanings.definition: To reverse the effects of conditioning.
meanings.sent1: She had to decondition her mind from associating sweets with happiness.
meanings.sent2: It takes time to decondition yourself from old habits.
meanings.sent3: Trying to decondition my dog from begging for treats is a challenge.
meanings.sent4: He needed to decondition his reflex to flinch at sudden noises.
meanings.sent5: To truly change, you must decondition your thoughts and beliefs.
